topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Deploying the Infoblox Patch

body.p: All three of the following patches should be applied with the following commands from the HLM host.

ol.li: Execute the following commands to copy each file to the /tmp/ directory on all three (3) of the non-KVM region controller nodes: ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2 -m copy -a "src=/tmp/check_horizon.sh.patch.gz dest=/tmp/check_horizon.sh.patch.gz" ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2 -m copy -a "src=/tmp/check_rabbitmq_api.sh.patch.gz dest=/tmp/check_rabbitmq_api.sh.patch.gz" ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2 -m copy -a "src=/tmp/icinga2_checks_fix1.patch.gz dest=/tmp/icinga2_checks_fix1.patch.gz" NOTE: Depending on the cloud template used the Ansible command may have to be altered from [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2 to [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T1

Execute the following commands to test that patches will apply properly: ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2 -m shell -a "(cd /var/tmp;zcat /tmp/check_horizon.sh.patch.gz | patch --dry-run)" ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2 -m shell -a "(cd /var/tmp;zcat /tmp/check_rabbitmq_api.sh.patch.gz | patch --dry-run)" ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2 -m shell -a "(cd /var/tmp;zcat /tmp/icinga2_checks_fix1.patch.gz | patch --dry-run)" If this worked in each case the text returned will look something like:
Where
cloudname is the name of your cloud
CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS is the name of your cloud in capital letters
If the test executed properly, in each case the text returned appears similar to the following:[CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2-M1-NETCLM | success | rc=0 >> checking file check_horizon.sh [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2-M2-NETCLM | success | rc=0 >> checking file check_horizon.sh [CLOUDNAMEINCAPSHERE]-CCP-T2-M3-NETCLM | success | rc=0 >> checking file check_horizon.sh

If tests execute properly, execute the following commands: ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2 -m shell -a "(cd /usr/lib/nagios/plugins/ ;zcat /tmp/check_horizon.sh.patch.gz | patch )" ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2 -m shell -a "(cd /usr/lib/nagios/plugins/ ;zcat /tmp/check_rabbitmq_api.sh.patch.gz | patch )" ansible -i /root/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/hosts -su cghelion [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2 -m shell -a "(cd /usr/lib/nagios/plugins/ ;zcat /tmp/icinga2_checks_fix1.patch.gz | patch )" The text returned from these should look something like: In each case the text returned appears similar to the following:[CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2-M2-NETCLM | success | rc=0 >> patching file check_horizon.sh [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2-M1-NETCLM | success | rc=0 >> patching file check_horizon.sh [CLOUDNAME_IN_CAPS]-CCP-T2-M3-NETCLM | success | rc=0 >> patching file check_horizon.sh

p.i: Return to installing the non-KVM region for the tahoe memphis or sacramento template.
